document.title: The Database Marketplace 2000: Are Online Companies Dinosaurs?
document.abstract: No player in the fee-based information industry can ignore the Internet, but many see it as an opportunity to expand services to their library customers rather than as a threat. Some companies that started in the CD-ROM business have adapted by offering web versions as well and are seeing much more growth in their web-based services. Gale Group is one that has successfully shifted its emphasis from CD-ROM to web versions. Gale's Beth Dempsey says, "The web has been a boon for Gale.
document.publication-title: School of Information Sciences -- Faculty Publications and Other Works
